definition: lit. after rain, the spring bamboo (idiom); fig. rapid new growth/many new things emerge in rapid succession
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
surname Chun
old variant of 春[chun1]
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
bamboo shoot

sentences.english: You know, these years, small-and-medium-sized enterprises appear like bamboo shoots after a spring rain.
sentences.chinese: 这些年来，中小企业像雨后春笋般涌现。

sentences.english: The bamboo shoots in spring crop out after rain.
Good ideas rise to the top in this new idea marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 好主意在这个创意市场上如雨后春笋般涌现。

sentences.english: At the later stage, more and more steamboat restaurants have sprung along Beach Road, Bugis.
sentences.chinese: 后来，美芝路的火锅店如雨后春笋般越来越多。

sentences.english: Shopping malls selling designer clothes and luxury hotels have sprung up.
sentences.chinese: 购物中心出售时尚成衣，豪华旅馆如雨后春笋。

sentences.english: Bilateral free-trade agreements are sprouting like weeds.
sentences.chinese: 双边自贸协定的涌现如雨后春笋。

sentences.english: The problem of illegal waste dumping has mushroomed in the last decade. ;
sentences.chinese: 非法倾倒垃圾的问题，在最近十年来如雨后春笋。

sentences.english: Charitable projects aimed at supporting the children are mushrooming in many parts of the country.
sentences.chinese: 旨在帮助儿童的慈善项目如雨后春笋般在全国发展。

sentences.english: City industries have sprung up like mushrooms after rain since liberation.
sentences.chinese: 解放后，城市工业雨后春笋般兴起。

sentences.english: Moreover, high-rise buildings springing up along the road going up.
sentences.chinese: 而且，路两旁的高楼大厦如雨后春笋拔地而起。

definition: to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
lit. arising suddenly above the level ground (idiom); sudden emergence of prominent new feature
(oil) blowout/surge/gush
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
to come thick and fast (idiom)
to emerge to meet a historic destiny (idiom)/to arise at an opportune time/able to take advantage of an opportunity/to rise to the occasion
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
lit. a force to smash bamboo (idiom); fig. irresistible force
to develop rapidly
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
one by one/one after another
wave/tides
